content.text:
# List of international presidential trips made by Charles de Gaulle

This is a list of international presidential trips made by Charles de Gaulle. He served as the President of France from 1959 to 1969, and became infamous for making inflammatory remarks that often violated diplomatic protocol. Throughout his presidency, he made state visits to twenty-six countries.
Summary of official trips
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Date(s)
! Country
! Details
! Ref.
|-
|23-29 June 1959
|
| Met with Rome mayor Urbano Cioccetti and Pope John XXIII.
|
|-
|5-8 April 1960
|
|Met with Queen Elizabeth II and gave her the French Order of Liberation awarded to her father George VI.
|
|-
|18–29 April 1960
|
|Visited Ottawa, Quebec City, Montreal, and Toronto before visiting Washington D.C., where he met with President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard Nixon. He then visited San Francisco and finally New Orleans.
|
|-
|23–24 October 1960
|
| Met with Prince Rainier III. This would be the last state visit to Monaco by a French president for 24 years.
|
|-
|20 May 1961
|
|Met with Chancellor Konrad Adenauer in Bonn.
|
|-
|24–26 November 1961
|
|Met with Prime Minister Harold Macmillan.
|
|-
|4–9 September 1962
|
| Met with Chancellor Konrad Adenauer in Cologne and Bonn.
|
|-
|16–20 May 1963
|  Greece
| Met with King Paul and visited Athens.
|
|-
|4–5 July 1963
|
|First visit after the signing of the Élysée Treaty in Paris six months prior.
|
|-
|16–20 October 1963
| Iran
| Met with the Shah of Iran and his wife. Visited Tehran, Isfahan, and the ruins of Persepolis.
|
|-
|15–24 March 1964
|
|Met with President Adolfo López Mateos, and gave a speech to a crowd of more than 300,000 people. See more.
|
|-
|3–4 July 1964
| West Germany
| Met Chancellor Ludwig Erhard in Bonn.
|
|-
|21 September – 16 October 1964
| Venezuela,,,,,,,,, Brazil
| See: Charles de Gaulle's trip to South America.
|
|-
|30 January 1965
|
|Attended the state funeral of Winston Churchill.
|
|-
|20 June – 1 July 1966
|
| Visited Moscow, Novosibirsk, Kiev, Leningrad, Volgograd, and the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Baikonur. Also signed the French-Soviet Joint Declaration of June 30, 1966.
|
|-
|26 August – 27 August 1966
| Ethiopia
|Visited Addis Ababa and met with the Ethiopian emperor Haile Selassie.
|
|-
|30 August – 2 September 1966
|
|Visited Phnom Penh and denounced American military intervention in Southeast Asia. See: Phnom Penh speech
|
|-
|12–13 July 1967
|
| Met with Chancellor Kurt Georg Kiesinger in Bonn.
|
|-
|24–27 July 1967
|
| Visited Montreal for the Expo 1967. The visit became infamous after he yelled "Vive le Québec libre" to a crowd of Quebec separatists.
|
|-
|6–12 September 1967
|
| Visited Warsaw, Gdańsk, and the Auschwitz concentration camp.
|
|-
|14–19 May 1968
|
| Met with Romanian leader Nicolae Ceaușescu.
|
|-
|27–28 September 1968
|
| Met with Chancellor Kurt Georg Kiesinger in Bonn. He had previously been to Germany in May after fleeing France because of the May 68 protests, but it was not a state visit.
|
|-
|25–31 October 1968
|
| Visited Ankara. This was his last international trip as president.
|
|}
See also
* Presidency of Charles de Gaulle
* Foreign policy of Charles de Gaulle
